fusion file came out in 2008 and
received minor updates which added
content from newer shows being
introduced on Cartoon Network and some
standard MMO fare in late 2011 the game
was completely restructured fusion fall
Academy took place after the defeat of
the alien invasion and focused on some
of the newer characters from Cartoon
Network's Renaissance period like Finn
the human and Oh Jake the dog
the game continued to receive sporadic
updates until late 2013 when the game
was formally shut down indefinitely
there was another fusion fall-related
game called fusion fall heroes where you
could actually play as the Cartoon
Network characters however the franchise
of different franchises was ultimately
abandoned that is until a group of fans
started both the fusion fall retro and
fusion fall Legacy Project fusion fall
retro is a rebuilt version of fusion
fall as if it were still 2008 while
fusion fall legacy is planned to be a
continued version of the 2011 update
with added missions characters items and
content these kinds of projects are
critical for game preservation and game
access especially in the modern age of
gaming emulation and ROM dumping is one
conversation you can still technically
get a copy of an out-of-print game it
might be expensive and inconvenient but
it's possible
however the internet in digital age of
gaming has brought a whole new
conversation surrounding game access and
preservation the conversation changes
when we're talking about games like
fusion fall MMO zaps browser games and
even games released on services like
Xbox Live Arcade many of these games
exist solely on a server and once the
entity who owns those games stop
supporting the server those games cease
to be available projects like fusion
fall retro and legacy are essential for
preservation and game access but often
the copyright owner doesn't allow them
to exist because they can compete with
an existing product but Time Warner or
Cartoon Network have the right to shut
it down whenever they want people who
